lessons.title: Stance
lessons.description: Your feet should be shoulder-width apart. Knees bent. Balance is key.
lessons.question: What's the best stance to keep your shot stable and balanced?
options: Feet shoulder-width apart with knees bent
One foot way ahead of the other

lessons.title: Hand Placement
lessons.description: Shooting hand under the ball, guide hand on the side.
lessons.question: Which hand placement helps you guide the ball without messing up the shot?
options: Guide hand under, shooting hand on top
Shooting hand under, guide hand on the side
Thumbs pressed together in the middle

lessons.title: Shooting Motion
lessons.description: Push up, elbow under the ball, release at the top of your jump.
lessons.question: When should you release the basketball for best accuracy and arc?
options: At the top of your jump

lessons.title: Follow Through
lessons.description: Snap your wrist and hold the gooseneck position.
lessons.question: What does a solid follow-through look like?
options: Wrists snapped with fingers pointing down like reaching in a cookie jar

lessons.title: Common Mistakes
lessons.description: Avoid thumbing the ball, leaning back, or not jumping.
lessons.question: Which habit messes up your shot form the most?
options: Leaning backward and thumbing the ball
